item.title: Shaken But Not Moved
item.description: It's better to get to Heaven bruised and beat up by life than to arrive in Hell broken for eternity. Sometimes God will shake your entire life up until He can get through to you. He will remove everything so that all that is left are things of an eternal nature. Join us on Sunday mornings for Dr. King's new series and learn how to stay unmoved in shaky seasons of life.
item.itunes:subtitle: It's better to get to Heaven bruised and beat up by life than to arrive in Hell broken for eternity. Sometimes God will shake your entire life until He can get through to you. Join us on Sunday mornings for Dr. King's new series & learn how to be unmoved.

item.title: Turning the Desert into an Oasis
item.description: Sometimes its easy for life to become a desert instead of an oasis. Listen and be encouraged as Dr. King explains how God wants to meet our needs and that this year we can turn the desert of 2011 into an oasis for 2012.

item.title: If Life Was a Book, What Would Your Next Chapter Be?
item.description: It's important to see your life as if it were a book, divided into many chapters. So as we kick off the new year, Dr. King helps us evaluate our lives and the things we wish to accomplish this year by helping us think through what each of us want our next chapter to look like.

item.title: Why Religious People are in Greater Danger of Going to Hell than Pornstars
item.description: Religion can be a nasty thing. Christians battle every day against it, comparing their sin to the sin of others. Listen and find out how we can overcome the bondage of religion and learn to be vulnerable, honest, and naked before Christ. There is no condemnation under Christ.

item.title: Living Well Tomorrow
item.description: Sometimes in life because of circumstances or situations it is easy to fall into a pit that causes you to not enjoy and pursue life and Christ passionately. But there is a way. Listen and be encouraged as Dr. King teaches us how we can actively live well tomorrow and climb ourselves out of the pit.

item.title: Multitude or Follower
item.description: To the multitudes, Christ probably wasn't what they expected. They were probably the typical church-going people, and when Christ came along who broke needless religious tradition, they must have been appalled and sent Him away. But those who had been touched by Christ knew the Truth and became followers. Are you a follower or a member of the crowd?
